Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: etush
Reviews.Content: in a very expensive city like venice this is a good option, the location is very convenient and easy to find! obviously dont expect any kind of luxury for the price you pay. we booked a double room with shared bathroom and we got a complentary upgrade to an ensuite double bedroom! which it was a nice start in venice, yeah the bedroom was tiny but was clean that is enough for us, as we didnt travel to venice to stay in the hotel. if you want to save some money in ur accomodation to spend in you shopping then this is an ideal option, if you want a new nice big room stay away from here but you will have to pay quite lot more.

Reviews.Title: “One nite stand”
Reviews.Author: BobandSharon
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location when arriving by train. We arrived after a cruise, took the new "People Mover" (cost 1 Euro) to Piazale Roma and then an easy 10 minute walk to the hotel. Our double room was on the 4th floor facing street. Very noisy all night long. Room itself was a little worn and in need of a redo. Bathroom was adequate. Did leave early the next morning so no breakfast but with a few bug bites. As far as recommending the hotel to friends, I'd really say it depended on which friends and the time of year they would be visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to train station and value for money (for Venice)”
Reviews.Author: 5murrell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Zecchini because it was very close to the train station and the ferry terminal. Had to check in at a neighbouring hotel because the Zecchini was unattended - also had to breakfast next door because the Zecchini did not offer any dining facilities. Reception was efficient enough, but without a smile or any friendliness. We were given a very large room on the first floor with a very modern en suite bathroom - in fact the whole hotel looked as though it had been refurbished quite recently. The breakfast next door, although adequate, was poor with little choice and uninteresting food. you cannot pay by credit card, it was cash only because the "communications link was down"; judging by the litter around the equipment, we suspect this is a pretty standard excuse to stop taking credit cards. Overall the hotel represents good value for money, for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: fussy35067
Reviews.Content: Booked into Atlantide, but note on door directed my friend and I to Zecchini. People at reception were nice and friendly. We were on the top floor - no elevator - meant dragging our suitcases up ourselves. Room with bathroom, all really very nice, clean. Our room was cleaned daily, and fresh towels left daily. Decent shower. Heater in bathroom. Mostly Italian channels on TV, obviously. We had breakfast brought to our room the first morning. Next two mornings, we ate in the breakfast room. Served eggs - you had to ask for them, tea, coffee, cereals, breads, fruit, crostoli! All quite filling. Really great location. Close to train station, and main bus station for Venice. Lots of good places to eat nearby. Supermarket about 10 minutes walk away. Nice stay, good value for money, great location!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this place!”
Reviews.Author: GUM_Brazil
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, stinky and hot. Rooms with air conditioning but they said it is only available in July!!! Ridiculous excuse. I was not able to sleep due to the incredible number of Mosquitos in my room at night. To make things even worse they don't have Internet signal, not even paid. Probably to prevent us from reviewing them on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “good price and location”
Reviews.Author: mariaBrazil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small, don't have an elevator! the brakfast is confuse, and simple. But is very near the Sta Lucia Station , what is good if you arrive in Venice at night. To look your hotel walking with bags, through the small streets it is not recommended, because you can loose yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheapie”
Reviews.Author: puddingthedog
Reviews.Content: I had booked into the neighbouring Atlantide, but being November there was a note on the door directing me to this hotel. Staff were very nice and helpful - although slightly impatient with the vending machine. The machine did coffee, but apparently not tea and when I tried, the hot chocolate was fine. The hotel is not the most romantic, but it is fine and in a great loactaion for a short trip to Venice - no fridge in the room. Would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Close to Bus and Train”
Reviews.Author: blackpearl123
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel do to its closeness to the Train and Bus locations. And, after two prior visits to Venice, I knew I did not want to "drag" my suitcase up bridges and cobblestone streets, especially in the evening. We picked the hotel based on location and reviews. We were arriving by bus and it was a short walk to the hotel. The reception area is a melange of artificial flowers and reminded me of a "yard sale" At first we were a little concerned, then they told us the hotel was "filled" and we were in the sister hotel two doors down. Ok, we followed the hostess to the hotel, secure outside door, up the steps and the hotel had been recently renovated and was amazing. We had a large room overlooking the street. Great bathroom with "rain" showers. And, it was very clean. A pleasant surprise. Breakfast was included with individually prepared eggs, meats, breads, beverages. We were only here for one night and they held our bags for the day. A short walk to the Vaporetta stop, small stores, little markets and internet across the street. It was a good choice, a little expensive, but it's Venice. Two late 50's ladies, would definitely stay here again. Great Location!

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station and good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: CJMVancouver
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at this hotel. The location was very close to the train station (5 minutes maybe less). There was no lift in the hotel which was kind of a pain. Check in was smooth and the guy at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Our room was TINY....not a lot of room to even put our suitcases on the floor, but we sort of expected that. The bathroom was very small as well. Our window overlooked the Lista de Spagna street. The room was very quiet at night even though we overlooked such a busy street. The breakfast was very good. Eggs, baked goods etc. I felt bad for the one server who was serving all the tables with a line up of people waiting. Get there early for breakfast! Otherwise expect to wait! We might stay there again. The only problem is it isn't that close to the main centre of Venice and it is really easy to get lost in Venice, so it took us even longer. Although, the best thing to do is just wander the streets and take in the sights and sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to Station but the reception is poor”
Reviews.Author: Cebuso
Reviews.Content: I am from Hong Kong and I have booked for a night in Venice. I have to carry two baggage and my little son with my wife and I chose this hotel because its location is close to station. The price is reasonable (99euros). I compared the hotels (close to station) in Venice and there are many more expensive hotels. However, I met an old man in reception when I arrived. My feeling was bad. He seemed to be not polite to me. It's not the time for me to check-in. I left my baggage and have a lunch near-by. When we return for check-in, another lady was in reception. She didn't speak too much when we checked in and didn't tell me the time and place for the breakfast. I asked her and thus knew the breakfast started on 0800am. It is not good for me as I have to got to train before 0843am so I did have a breakfast within a short time. There is not enough place for breakfast as well (Maximum of 12 at the same time). I dont think this hotel can be recommended only if they can change their service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but terrible rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kewpielovesyou
Reviews.Content: You could roll yourself from Santa Maria Train station to this 'hotel' - barely 200m and you're there. Small reception. No lift. Extremely tight stairs to go up. Narrow corridors, prison-cell room with very santized scent in room and bed linen. I could not work out whether the room was really carrying a disinfectant smell or whether it reeked of cockroaches. TV was old....but least it worked. Breakfast room was a shoebox. Had no space to accommodate everyone. I didn't want to wait, so I went out and had brekkie instead. PLUS points: location is unrivaled. Close to the water taxi. Food is everywhere. Love Venice. I would choose another hotel the next time though. NEGATIVE: the reception person needs to have abit more life in him!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PRICE FOR VALUE.”
Reviews.Author: traveler110807
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Europe, we went for our honeymoon. If you are not too "picky" this is a great hotel. We like a clean room that is the most important thing other than spacious or luxurious. This hotel is a few steps from train station. If you like to sightsee this is the perfect location because it is located at the beginning of the Venice alleys. The hotel rooms are reasonable although very european style (small) although the bathroom was big. The cafeteria was very small but reasonable for the price. Watch out with the suitcases because there is no elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel through finding a great deal at Hotelclub, and also some friends had stayed there in Sept. The deal was 66 euros a night, I had previously stayed at the Minerva Hotel 1 block away for 70 euro but there was no ensuite bathroom and no breakfast. so I could not believe the offer for the Zecchini, thought it may be too good to be true ! But I was pleasantly surprised, it was a nice reception with lovely marble staircase, no elevator but each floor had a comfy settee, in case a rest was needed. My room on the 3rd floor was small but not too bad, spotlessly clean with a nice size bathroom with shower cubicle, again spotless. On first sight I thought the window just faced a blank wall, which it did but on looking down there was a lovely quaint little calle. The only problem was the room was a little on the dark side. The breakfast room was cute, but only about six tables, I did have to wait for a free table. there was the usual selection of cereals, juices, croissants etc, also hard boiled eggs or scrambled. The breakfast certainly filled a gap and I have had worse. the coffee was excellent. I also choose the hotel as it was on the Lista di Spagna, very close to the Train Station and Piazalle Roma for the bus stop, only about a 10 min walk, which is important with luggage. I very much enjoyed my stay here, the staff were lovley and helpful, and I was given a take-away breakfast as I had an early morning bus to catch. highly recommended and I would stay here again at such a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, good location though”
Reviews.Author: jpdogg
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location being just a very short walk from the Bus / train station. The check-in area was good, and we received a fairly nice welcome by the staff. The room was very average and was in serious need of re-decoration. TV was crap and barely worked, CNN as the only english channel, shower was good. Think the bed had bugs as I am still itching. The included breakfast is nothing great though I guess its better than nothing. Overall I wouldn't stay here again, however accomodation in Venice is very expensive and it seems difficult to find a bargain here so never say never!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Wrenvend
Reviews.Content: just come home from staying two nights at the zechinni hotel.i was a single traveller, the location is excellent and the price cheap for central venice. However my room was terrible, tv did not work, i had a 6.30 am morning call each day ( i did not book one ).sheets,towells never changed, room dirty, i have several bug bites all over me and i am off to the doctors now. do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: winkmiester
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a fabulous location, steps away from the train station! Hotel is small....all the hotels in Italy are small, get used to it! The hotel staff was helpful and polite. Breakfast room was VERY crowded, and some mornings you may have to wait a 1/2 before even being seated. Not really worth the wait, unless you absolutely need something to eat. But otherwise loved the hotel and loved venice.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Tamara444
Reviews.Content: If what you want is a base that is clean and convenient then the Hotel Zecchini will be fine. Come out of the train station, turn right and within a minute you are there. Close to the water bus stop. Main bus station about 5mins walk. Going around the narrow streets with cases could have been a nightmare so we felt lucky to have chosen this hotel. Breakfast was in a rather small room with not enough places for even half of the guests so you may have a wait. This was not too much of a problem for us as we were there in April and the hotel was not full. However food is topped up regularly (yummy yoghurt) and a bread roll and croissant are brought to your table along with tea/coffee/chocolate. They also make scambled egg for you if requested. I think we hit unlucky with our twin room. Nothing like their photos and really should have been a single. Small and narrow room. Lengthways along the wall were a single bed, then a wardrobe and then a single couch type bed with a pull out mattress underneath. If there are three in the room then using the pull out would take up the total width of the room and block the exit. There was a tv in the room but it was not tuned. Bathroom was small but the shower was a decent enough size and water was hot. Bedding and towels were clean. Soap and shampoo/body wash provided. Daily maid service. Our room was at the back so was quiet. No air con.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NadiyaV
Reviews.Content: We were quite happy with the hotel. It is just 200 meters from the train station in Venice on a pedestrian street. The boat station from where we could go to St.Mark Square is also nearby across the train station. Even though around the hotel are shops and cafes, it was quite at night to have a good sleep. The room and bathroom are VERY SMALL, but clean and nice. The breakfast was also ok. Overall, we think that the hotel is worth the money paid (about 100 euro for double room on Easter Friday).

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the mainland!”
Reviews.Author: Matti-Pringle
Reviews.Content: As expensive as Venice is, for 78 Euros I did not expect to get a corridor-shaped room with wallpaper coming off the wall and veneer missing off the furniture. In truth, Hotel Zecchini is neither cheap, nor particualrly cheerful and certainly does not meet its stated two star rating. I was therefore very surprised to read that it has received relatively positive reviews on Tripadvisor. So, perhaps it was just me! The last time I visited Venice I stayed in near-by and significantly cheaper Padova and used it as a basis to visit Venice and Verona. For the traveller who does not have his or her heart set on staying on the island, this might be a better option. You will definitely get much more for your hard-earned money and avoid couldn't-care-less hotels like the Zecchini.

Reviews.Title: “Little hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: charlotter88
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Venice and the last time my hotel was pretty far removed from old Venice. This time we stayed at the Zecchini and it is on a wonderful street with a lot of atmosphere. The location is great and very near the train station and bus station. We came in on the train and were able to walk to the hotel with no problem. We flew out of Venice very early in the morning and the bus station is also walking distance with a bus that runs frequently to the airport starting around 5:00 AM. The hotel itself is small, the rooms are small and the breakfast room is small. But it is a typical European hotel. Be warned...there is no lift and you may be on the fourth floor and have to pack your bags all the way up. We knew this before we booked but did not factor in that this was our last stop in a series of five and our bags were very, very heavy by this time. Lucky for me, I have a strong friend. We shared a bathroom on the second floor but it proved to be no problem. We never saw signs of anyone else even using it. One of the nights there were a group of young people staying and being young people they were quite noisy. The hotel staff does a good job in keeping the noise down though. In fact when I got up to use the bathroom the first night the night desk clerk came up the stairs to remind me to be quiet. (I thought I was). It was not a bad stay. I had gotten spoiled with our luck with the other hotels on our trip being way above average so I would have to say that The Zecchini was the worst of the lot but not truly bad. I have stayed in much worse in Europe. You get what you pay for and I think The Zecchini is a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location--that is all.”
Reviews.Author: jacquelineNewYork
Reviews.Content: Don't book this hotel through hotels.com that is first off--they will rip you off. Book directly through the hotel. The good thing is the location of this hotel. It is near the train station and so it is great for travel. The bad thing is pretty much everything else. The stairs all the way up to a dingy room are upsetting, the room was clean but not totally, I slept on my towel because my friend developed a rash, we fear from the green bedspread. There was an air conditioner, which was great, but the hose to the air conditioner went outside the window and so you couldn't close the window at night or in the day so you were eaten alive with mosquitos. If that wasn't enough, the rain came in and got my leg all wet--again, because you'd rather be wet than die of heat stroke. Again, that would be ok if I hadn't fallen out of the sloping bed. Yes, it sloped so much I nearly plummeted to the ground. So, all in all, you were basically not sleeping here what with noise from other rooms, heat, bedbugs--I'm sure, and goodness knows what else--you won't be doing much sleeping here. Then again, it gave us NO reason to stay in the hotel and all the more reason to get outside and visit Venice! The one good thing--the phone worked, but you couldn't dial to the reception, you had to walk down all those stairs just to ask them to ring you for a wake up call, but like I said, you didn't need a wake up call--you weren't sleeping any time soon in this hotel. Location was key, but I saw a few other hotels right near this one that were better looking and I'd stay there next time--for the amount I paid per night--NOT WORTH IT AT ALL--don't do it!! Trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere......... you'll thank yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Edsco
Reviews.Content: Check-in date Tue, May 29, 2007 Check-out date Jun 2, 2007 Rooms:1 room(s) @ $105.00 per night x4 night(s) Taxes recovery charges and fees TaxesAndFees $60.27 TotalPrice $480.27 I had originally booked a room at Hotel Ariel Silva w/ a shared bath... I should have stayed with my original plan. I opted for ensuite and booked a room on Hotwire. Behold, upon arrival I learned that my room # 23 / 2nd floor had a shared bath. The shared bath was on the 3rd floor and 4th floor. Pros: The location was convenient and the hotel was easy to find. Cons: Room 23 faced Lista di Spagna... main pedestrian street. Luckily I brought earplugs as I left the window open during the night for air circulation. Mosquitos were a slight problem. I would find 3-4 in the room every morning as there were no screens on the window. The room did not have a/c but , a floor model fan. I found it hard to believe that of all the rooms in this hotel..... I was told that I would be sharing the baths with 2 other rooms. It seemed every time I used the bath or shower someone was always yanking on the door and trying to get in. Don't bother with the continental breakfast. It consisted of Melba toast, stale croissants, coffee (tasted like instant coffee to me) I couldn't beleive folks were waiting in line to eat that junk. Luckily during my stay 29May - 2Jun the weather was warm but not overwhelming. If you are to stay at this hotel in the height of the Summer I would demand a portable AC unit as I had seen in some rooms while they were being cleaned. Honestly, $105.00 USD/night is not a lot of money. But, as some other posts have stated this hotel is a DUMP! Venice was amazing! I went solo and I would definitely visit Venice again. I personally would up the ante $$$ for a hotel during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: prinses
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Zecchini during May 2006. The location is perfect!! The room was comfortable and we enjoyed the street-facing view. The breakfast was good. The only complaint was the schoolgroup that stayed there, making a lot of noise at night and their prescence made the breakfast room feel very crowded. (They were just normal kids enjoying their holiday!). Still, we would stay here again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot....or too hot....”
Reviews.Author: carelour
Reviews.Content: First of all, I know Venice is expensive...but if you're traveling in the summer months, you NEED a hotel with air conditioning if you don't want to shoot yourself...which I almost did when I stayed at this hotel. First off, Expedia made this hotel seem much better than it was (photos, description). We were supposed to have a ceiling fan -something we found out not 1 room has at this hotel. The sheets had burn marks and holes, and the safe barely fit our passports! The fire detector was unplugged (wired out for display) and the sweltering heat made our September stay unbearable. For $200 per night, we expected something that felt like more than a youth hostile. HOWEVER, it was conveniently located right next to the train station, and it was clean. When I heard of people complaining of bed bug bites, I realized things could have been much much worse than uncomfortable beds and being too hot.

HotelInfo.Name: Zecchini Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lista di Spagna 152, 30121 Venice, Italy
